entry.title: MORNING CONVERSATION 9.16.25
entry.summary: First District State Representative Court Boice talks about the rally in remembrance of Charlie Kirk, held in Roseburg on Monday night.

entry.title: DFPA Confirms Six Prescribed Burns Scheduled This Week
entry.summary: DFPA has six prescribed burns scheduled this week: Sept. 16 in Oakland & Roseburg, Sept. 17 in Oakland & Roseburg, Sept. 18 on N. Umpqua Hwy in Roseburg, and Sept. 20 on Roberts Creek Rd in Roseburg. Burns aim to reduce wildfire risk under safe conditions.

entry.summary: The Roseburg Receiver Morning Scoop

entry.title: RECORD BREAKING HEAT EXPECTED FOR TUESDAY
entry.summary: September 16, 2025 4:10 a.m. Tuesday could see a record breaking high for the date in Roseburg. Forecasters at the National Weather Service in Medford told News Radio 93-9 FM and 1240 KQEN that a ridge of high pressure aloft is bringing a warm air mass into the region. Roseburg is expecting a high temperature...

entry.title: NORTH DOUGLAS COUNTY FIRE & EMS DEAL WITH STRUCTURE FIRE FRIDAY
entry.summary: September 16, 2025 3:50 a.m. Crews with North Douglas County Fire & EMS dealt with a structure fire in the Yoncalla area late Friday afternoon. Fire Chief Brian Burke said the fire was reported at approximately 4:20 p.m. with callers saying that flames were visible coming from a window and the front door. Burke said...

entry.title: REPRESENTATIVE OSBORNE SEEKS THIRD TERM IN HOUSE DISTRICT TWO
entry.summary: September 16, 2025 3:30 a.m. State Representative Virgle Osborne has officially announced his campaign for re-election to serve Oregon House District 2, which includes most of Douglas County. entry.title: OREGON HIGHWAY 42 PAVING IS UNDERWAY IN THE GREEN DISTRICT

entry.title: WINSTON-DILLARD MELON FESTIVAL HAPPENING FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY
entry.summary: September 16, 2025 3:05 a.m. The 56th annual Winston-Dillard Melon Festival is happening this Friday through Sunday. “The Last Slice of Summer” is this year’s theme. The event takes place at Winston’s Riverbend Park. The festival includes live music, food and craft vendors, kids’ games, a scavenger hunt, senior bingo, talent show, mud volleyball and...

entry.title: SISKIYOU MOUNTAIN FILM TOUR IN ROSEBURG THURSDAY NIGHT

There will be a free screening of three brand new documentary shorts that celebrate the public...

entry.title: Three people found dead in RV from suspected overdoses
entry.summary: Tragedy struck at Shady Point RV Park, just south of Roseburg, where three individuals were found dead and one in medical distress from a suspected drug overdose.

entry.title: DINT INFORMATION ON DRUG OVERDOSE DEATHS
entry.summary: September 15, 4:50 p.m. The Douglas Interagency Narcotics Team has released information on drug overdose deaths which took place over the weekend. McArthur said...

entry.title: Bureau of Land Management plans trail maintenance day for Susan Creek Falls
entry.summary: Every Sept. 27, organizations across the country celebrate National Public Lands Day, a holiday dedicated to the conservation of public lands and the enrichment they bring to communities.

entry.title: Winston’s Now N Then Antique Mall Closing After 19 Years
entry.summary: Winston’s Now N Then Antique Mall may close Oct. 3 after 19 years unless an attorney can secure a lease extension. Specials include 50% off items marked 22 or 222. Vendors notified, showcases for sale, and a final parking lot sale may be held.

entry.title: 'Picasso at the Lapin Agile' continues at UACT
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — "Picasso at the Lapin Agile" continues through Sept. 24 at Umpqua Actors Community Theatre on West Harvard Avenue in Roseburg.

entry.title: Dancing in the street at the Umpqua Valley Farmer's Market
entry.summary: Corazón Oaxaqueño took over the center of the Umpqua Valley Farmers Market for more than an hour Saturday, performing three dances that each ran about 15 minutes and resembled short musicals. The routines included themes, plots and even a bullfight.

entry.title: What is bluegrass?
entry.summary: ELKTON — How to differentiate bluegrass music from country and folk?

entry.title: Outdoor living space a new addition to Showcase of Homes
entry.summary: There's not much room left on the hills above Roseburg's Hucrest neighborhood, but Kennaday Builders, LLC, was able to fit a new house between two others.

entry.title: Republican party hosting Charlie Kirk remembrance event
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — The Douglas County Republican Party is hosting an event to honor the legacy of Charlie Kirk on Monday night.

entry.title: CASA of Douglas County to hold charity auction Saturday
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — CASA of Douglas County will hold its annual charity auction on Saturday, Sept. 20 at the Roseburg Country Club.

entry.summary: ROSEBURG — The city of Roseburg is taking applications from people interested in serving on a city commission.

entry.title: DFPA to begin issuing permits for prescribed pasture burns
entry.summary: Douglas Forest Protective Association (DFPA) will begin issuing permits for prescribed pasture burns as conditions allow.

entry.title: REPUBLICAN PARTY HOSTING CHARLIE KIRK REMEMBRANCE

entry.title: FOUR ROSEBURG CITY COMMISSONS HAVE OPENINGS
entry.summary: September 15, 2025 3:40 a.m. The City of Roseburg is taking applications from people interested in serving on a city commission. The planning and public works commissions have two vacancies each while the other commissions have one...

entry.title: BLM TIMBER SALES TO OFFER NEARLY 40 MILLION BOARD FEET
entry.summary: September 15, 2025 3:30 a.m. The Bureau of Land Management will offer six timber sales in September, totaling 39.7 million board feet to be harvested from 3,470 public acres across western Oregon, including in Douglas County. BLM Oregon/Washington State Director Barry Bushue said, “Timber harvested from public lands provides essential benefits to our nation, from...

entry.title: CASA OF DOUGLAS COUNTY TO HOLD CHARITY AUCTION SEPTEMBER 20TH
entry.summary: September 15, 2025 3:20 a.m. CASA of Douglas County will hold their Annual Charity Auction on Saturday, September 20th at the Roseburg Country Club. entry.title: Fire safety boost: Prescribed burns return to Douglas County
entry.summary: The Douglas Forest Protective Association (DFPA) is set to issue permits for prescribed pasture burning as conditions allow.

entry.title: Coos Bay man gets 20 years for fatal drunk driving crash
entry.summary: The driver involved in a tragic bus crash that claimed the lives of a softball coach and player has been sentenced to more than 20 years in prison.
